game.title: Klondike (3 cards)
game.info: Klondike is a patience game (solitaire card game). Many people refer to Klondike as patience or solitaire, it being one of the better known of the family of patience games.
game.rules:
Goal:

Move all the card to the Foundations

Foundation:

  • Build up from rank and from suit from Ace to King
  • The top card may be moved

Tableau:

  • Build down by rank and by alternating color
  • The top card may be moved
  • Complete or partial correct piles may be moved
  • An empty spot may be filled with a King or a pile starting with a King

Stock:

  • Click to face up and move 3 cards to the Waste
  • When empty, click to face down and move all cards from the Waste to the Stock

Waste:

  • Top card may be moved

game.title: Spider
game.info: Spider is a type of Patience game. It is one of the more popular two-deck solitaire games.
game.rules:
Goal:

Move all the card to the Foundations

Foundation:

  • Automaticly filled when a Tableau spot contains a pile ordered down by rank and by suit from King to Ace
  • The top card may be moved

Tableau:

  • Build down by rank
  • The top card may be moved
  • Complete or partial correct piles may be moved as long as they share the same suit
  • An empty spot may be filled with any card or correct piles with the same suit

Stock:

  • Can only be click if all Tableau spots are empty
  • Click to face up and move one card to each Tableau spot

game.title: Pyramid
game.info: Pyramid is a solitaire game where the object is to get all the cards from the pyramid to the Foundation.
game.rules:
Goal:

Move all the card to the Foundation

Foundation:

  • Paired cards move here

Tableau:

  • Only exposed cards may be moved
  • If you drop a card over another that combine to 13, then they are moved to the Foundation
  • King is 13, Queen 12 and Jack 11

Stock:

  • Click to top face down card to face it up
  • Face up card may be moved
  • Click face up card to move it to Waste

Waste:

  • Top card may be moved

game.title: Aces Up
game.info: Aces Up (also known as Idiot's Delight, Once in a Lifetime, Ace of the Pile, Rocket to the Top, Firing Squad, Loser Solitaire, Aces High, and Drivel) is a solitaire card game using a deck of 52 playing cards. One advantage of this game is its minimal use of space: one can even play it on an area as small as an encyclopedia volume cover.
game.rules:
Goal:

Move all the cards except the Aces to the Foundation

Foundation:

  • Played cards move here

Tableau:

  • If the top card is the same suit but of lower rank than the top card of another Tableau spot, then you can click it to play it to the Foundation
  • An empty spot may be filled with the top card of another Tableau spot

Stock:

  • Click to face up and move one card to each Tableau spot

game.title: Freecell
game.rules:
Goal:

Move all the card to the Foundations

Foundation:

  • Build up from rank and from suit from Ace to King
  • The top card may be moved

Tableau:

  • Build down by rank and by alternating color
  • The top card may be moved

  • An empty spot may be filled with any card

Cell:

  • May only contain one card
  • Top card may be moved

game.title: Baker's Dozen
game.info: Baker's Dozen is a solitaire card game using a deck of fifty-two playing cards. The game is so called because of the 13 columns in the game, the number in a baker's dozen.
game.rules:
Goal:

Move all the card to the Foundations

Foundation:

  • Build up by rank and by suit from Ace to King
  • The top card may be moved

Tableau:

  • Build down by rank
  • The top card may be moved
  • An empty spot may NOT be filled
  • All kings are moved to the bottom after dealing
